business.headline: Rupee hits historic low of 91 against US dollar. What's behind this drop?The rupee breached the 91 mark against the US dollar for the first time on Tuesday, extending its run of losses amid sustained foreign fund outflows and market uncertainty.

Missed the December advance tax deadline? This is the interest you may have to payIf you missed the December advance tax deadline, don't panic just yet. There is no direct penalty, but interest will apply. Here's what the Income Tax Act says and how much it may cost you.
Sensex ends 533 points lower, Nifty below 25,900; Axis Bank down 5%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 533.50 points to close at 84,679.86, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 167.20 points to end at 25,860.10.

India loses billions yearly as global finance favours rich nations: ReportPoorer and emerging economies like India consistently pay more to the global financial system than they receive back, while rich countries continue to benefit from lower costs and higher returns.​

Will your loan EMI fall? SBI cuts lending rates, lowers interest on select FDThe State Bank of India has announced reductions in both lending and select deposit rates, aiming to balance relief for borrowers with steady returns for most deposit holders.

Gifts from family are tax-free. But who exactly qualifies as 'family'?Received money or property from a family member and assumed it is tax-free? Do you know whether the Income Tax Act actually treats that person as 'family'? Let's find out.

ICICI Prudential AMC IPO GMP today. Check allotment and listing detailsThe trend in the unofficial market has strengthened as the ICICI Prudential AMC IPO moved closer to closing, supported by improving subscription numbers across investor categories.

How is young India really investing money? Hint: It's not just stocks or gadgetsFrom digital assets to experiences, India's younger generation is investing in ways that reflect changing priorities and lifestyles. Let's have a look.

Who is Meesho founder Vidit Aatrey, latest entrant to India's billionaire clubVidit Aatrey, the co-founder of Meesho Ltd, has entered the billionaire club as the company's shares climbed sharply to hit a fresh 52-week high in today's trade.

Income Tax Department flags fake donation claims, tightens checks on tax refundsSeveral taxpayers claimed refunds by showing fake donations to political parties and charitable institutions, often with the help of intermediaries. The Income Tax department has now warned that such practices are under close watch.

8th Pay Commission arrears to start from January 1, 2026? Here's latest updateIn November 2025, the government approved the terms of reference for the 8th Pay Commission and granted it 18 months to submit its report.
Sensex opens 300 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; Eternal down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 381.44 points to 84,831.92, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 114.55 points to 25,912.75 as of 9:40 am.

ICICI Prudential IPO closes today: Should you bid as GMP crosses 10% gain?ICICI Prudential AMC IPO opened for bidding on December 12, 2025, and will close today, December 16, 2025. Share allotment is expected to be finalised on December 17, while listing on BSE and NSE is scheduled for December 19, 2025.

WPI inflation stays negative in November despite food price uptickGovernment data released on Monday showed Wholesale Price Index (WPI) inflation at (-) 0.32% in November, compared with (-) 1.21% in October.
India's exports jump 19% in November, trade deficit hits 5-month lowThe US remained India's largest export destination from April to November 2025, despite the imposition of a 50% tariff.

Sensex, Nifty rebound to end marginally lower as FII outflow troubles marketThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 54.30 points to close at 85,213.36, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 19.65 points to end at 26,027.30.

SBI reduces lending rates, EMIs likely to drop: Check new home loan ratesWith several major banks already passing on the benefit, SBI's move will directly help customers whose loans are linked to different lending benchmarks.

Gold and silver at record highs. Should investors buy now or wait?Gold and silver prices are trading near record highs after a powerful rally this year. With both metals delivering strong returns, many investors are now wondering whether it still makes sense to buy or wait for a correction.

December 15 advance tax deadline is here: Who must pay and what happens if you don'tThe third advance tax instalment is due today, December 15. For many taxpayers, missing this deadline could mean mandatory interest and a larger payment at the time of filing returns.

Claimed tax refunds using fake donations? Here's what income tax department is doingIf you claimed tax benefits by showing donations that were never made, the Income Tax Department may already be watching. Authorities have launched a fresh drive to identify and correct such false claims.

entertainment.headline: R Ashwin defends Rajinikanth's Coolie, questions online review culture The former India cricketer R Ashwin said he watched Rajinikanth's Coolie in one stretch on OTT and did not agree with the negative social media verdict.

The box office vs the attention-span: Dhurandhar debunks the panic The success of films like the 3-hour, 34-minute 'Dhurandhar' challenges the shrinking attention-span narrative. Audiences, including Gen Z, are rejecting filler, not length; they commit when storytelling is compelling, proving that content holds creators accountable for every minute used.

Sonarika Bhadoria-Vikas Parashar name daughter Virika. Here's what it means Television actor Sonarika Bhadoria and her husband Vikas Parashar have named their newborn daughter Virika Parashar, blending elements from their own names. The couple shared the news and photos from the naming ceremony on social media.

Team India watches Dhurandhar in Lucknow before T20 match with South Africa Ahead of their high-stakes match against South Africa, the Indian T20 team spent Monday evening in Lucknow watching Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' at the Phoenix Palassio mall.

Films denied permission, will be screened at Kerala festival: CM Pinarayi Vijayan Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan said that all films that were denied screening at the International Film Festival of Kerala (IFFK), would still be screened as part of the festival.

Ahan Shetty shares what Suniel Shetty advised him for Border 2 At the teaser launch event in Mumbai, Ahan Shetty spoke about the guidance he received from his father, Suniel Shetty, for 'Border 2'. The actor said his father advised him not to compare the film to the iconic 1997 film.

Abhishek Bachchan praises nephew Agastya's Ikkis role: You are a sincere actor As Agastya Nanda prepares for his role as Second Lieutenant Arun Khetarpal in Sriram Raghavan's war film Ikkis, his uncle Abhishek Bachchan shared a post and highlighted the significance of portraying the decorated Indian Army officer.

500 workers, 20 days, one city: How Dhurandhar recreated Lyari in Bangkok Dhurandhar's production designer reveals how Lyari was recreated on a six-acre set in Bangkok with 500 workers in just 20 days.

Dharmendra's Yamla Pagla Deewana likely to return to theatres. Check details The 2011 hit 'Yamla Pagla Deewana', starring Dharmendra and his sons Sunny Deol and Bobby Deol, is set for a theatrical re-release as a tribute to the late actor. Here's when the film is expected to release in theatres.

Angad Bedi: I was once rejected by Neha Dhupia's parents, KJo played cupid Angad Bedi has shared how Neha Dhupia's parents initially rejected his marriage proposal. He revealed that filmmaker Karan Johar later played a pivotal role in bringing the couple together.

Padayappa re-release: Sivakarthikeyan's Thalaiva moment goes viral. Watch The restored version of Padayappa, re-released to mark Rajinikanth's 75th birthday and 50 years in cinema, has turned theatres into celebration zones, with actor Sivakarthikeyan's fan moment becoming the latest highlight.

Pawan Kalyan gifts OG director Sujeeth Rs 3 crore Land Rover after film's success Following the commercial success of the film OG, actor and Deputy Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh Pawan Kalyan has gifted director Sujeeth a Land Rover Defender valued at approximately Rs 3 crore, as a gesture of appreciation.

Nick Jonas vibing to Aavan Jaavan from War 2 gets groovy nod from Hrithik-Kiara Hrithik Roshan and Kiara Advani reacted to Nick Jonas's musical jam session featuring the song 'Aavan Jaavan' from 'War 2' (2025). The video shared by the American singer also drew attention from both fans and industry circles.

Sunny Deol gets teary-eyed at Border 2 event after father Dharmendra's death Sunny Deol attended the teaser launch for his upcoming film Border 2, marking his first public event since the death of his father, veteran actor Dharmendra. The actor was visibly emotional during the occasion as he addressed the audience.

BTS' new OT7 live amid controversy is exactly what ARMY needed; here's why BTS reunited for a surprise group livestream ahead of Christmas and New Year, brushing aside recent online discourse with laughter, chaos and genuine camaraderie.

45 trailer: Shivarajkumar, Upendra, Raj B Shetty bring life and death philosophies The makers of the much-anticipated multi-starrer 45 have unveiled its official trailer, offering a haunting and introspective look at a story that explores life, morality and the weight of human choices beyond death.

Villains in vogue: Mogambo to Kali, how Bollywood antagonists mirror society Bollywood villains have evolved from simple, one-dimensional characters to complex, multi-layered figures. Writer Javed Akhtar discusses how socio-political changes have influenced Hindi film villains, reflecting societal attitudes. And yes, Shah Rukh Khan has played a big role in this evolution.

Border 2 teaser: Sunny Deol rallies his men with a war cry meant to reach Lahore Border 2 teaser unveils Sunny Deol, Varun Dhawan, Diljit Dosanjh and Ahan Shetty as war heroes in a stirring tribute to India's armed forces.

Explained: Rob Reiner's death and row over Donald Trump's inflammatory post Rob Reiner and his wife Michele were tragically stabbed to death at their Los Angeles home. The incident and President Donald Trump's politicising comments have ignited widespread outrage and debate.

general news.headline: SHANTI Bill tabled: Your cheat sheet on India's biggest nuclear energy reformThe government tabled the Sustainable Harnessing and Advancement of Nuclear Energy for Transforming India (SHANTI) Bill, 2025 in the Lok Sabha, signalling a major overhaul of India's civil nuclear framework. The Bill aims to end the decades-long state monopoly on nuclear power and enable private sector participation.

Bondi shooter migrated from Hyderabad, family cut ties for marrying ChristianSajid Akram, one of the Sydney Bondi Beach shooters, migrated from Hyderabad in 1998, says Telangana Police. He had limited contact with his family in India and visited the country only six times in 27 years.

Live: RCB buy uncapped fast boler Mangesh Yadav for Rs 5.2 croreIPL Auction 2026 live updates: The accelerated round is on. Kolkata Knight Riders have bought Bangladesh's Mustafizur Rahman for Rs 9.2 crore. Gujarat Titans buy Jason Holder for Rs 7 crore. Chennai Super Kings have gone away from their DNA, splurging big on uncapped players. They spent Rs 14.2 crore each on UP all-rounder Prashant Veer and Rajasthan wicketkeeper Kartik Sharma.

Will cut off 7 sisters from India, says Bangladesh leader; Assam CM reactsBangladesh NCP leader Hasnat Abdullah warned that Dhaka could shelter anti-India forces and threatened to "sever the seven sisters," referring to India's northeastern states.

How Pak let off Generals Ayub, Niazi but damned women, wine and sex for '71 defeatHalf a nation gone, 93,000 soldiers captured. And in the years that followed, Pakistan would ask itself one haunting question: How? The answer, according to the Pakistani government's own investigation, would prove more scandalous than the defeat itself. Here's a look back at the scandal as India celebrates Vijay Diwas.

After Jordan King, Ethiopia PM drives PM Modi in his car in special gestureAfter Jordan, Ethiopia's Nobel Peace Prize-winning Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed personally received PM Modi at Addis Ababa airport on Tuesday, drove him to his hotel, and made an unscheduled stop at the Science Museum and Friendship Park.

Sorry, Delhi, but impossible for any…: Minister's half-apology over pollutionDelhi Environment Minister, while speaking at a press briefing, apologised to the people of Delhi and said it was impossible for any elected government to completely reduce pollution levels within nine to ten months.

IPL Auction 2026: Full list of sold, unsold, retained players of all 10 teamsIPL 2026 Auction: Prashant Veer and Kartik Sharma stole the spotlight as the costliest Indian buys of the day, with CSK splurging Rs 14.2 crore on each. The duo also created history by becoming the joint-most-expensive uncapped players in IPL auction history. Meanwhile, Delhi Capitals made a notable move by signing Auqib Nabi Dar for Rs 8.4 crore. Here is the full list of sold, unsold and retained players of all 10 teams.

500 workers, 20 days, one city: How Dhurandhar recreated Lyari in BangkokDhurandhar's production designer reveals how Lyari was recreated on a six-acre set in Bangkok with 500 workers in just 20 days.

National Herald case against Sonia, Rahul collapses; court throws out ED chargesheetThe Court said the complaint filed by ED under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act was not maintainable as the case was based on a private complaint and not an FIR.

Jadeja 2.0? CSK buy uncapped Prashant Veer for record sum of Rs 14.2 croreIPL 2026 auction: Chennai Super Kings bought spin-bowling all-rounder Prashant Veer for Rs 14.20 crore, making him the joint-most expensive uncapped player in the history of the auction. They also spent Rs 14.2 crore for Rajasthan's Kartik Sharma.

Great friend: In surprise shoutout, US embassy shares Trump's praise for PM ModiThe message comes as a US delegation visited New Delhi to advance a trade deal. Trump's shoutout, recognising India as a key strategic ally in the Indian Ocean, follows India's agreement allowing Russian military logistical access in the region.

Virat Kohli, wife Anushka visit Premanand Maharaj, video captures emotional momentVirat Kohli skipped the spotlight surrounding Lionel Messi's India tour. The former India captain instead visited Premanand Ji Maharaj in Vrindavan with wife Anushka Sharma for spiritual reflection.

Vijay Diwas: The 1971 Pakistan war that forged India–Russia tiesThe turning point came when India decided to leverage the special understanding between the two sides and requested Moscow to activate the Indo-Soviet security treaty, under which the erstwhile Soviet Union was bound to defend India in the event of any external aggression.

Final batch of 3 US-made Apache AH-64E attack choppers arrive in IndiaThe Army received the final three Apache AH-64E attack helicopters from the US, completing its six-aircraft fleet at the 451 Army Aviation Squadron in Rajasthan's Jodhpur.

G RAM G faces opposition even from BJP ally. And it's not just the nameThe VB-G RAM G Bill proposes to replace the existing MGNREGA. It has created an uproar in the Opposition benches over the dropping of Mahatma Gandhi's name from India's flagship rural employment scheme. However, the Bill has also faced concerns from a key BJP ally, the Chandrababu Naidu-led TDP. It warned that the changes could strain state finances.

Ex-Miss Switzerland finalist's husband, who dismembered her, charged with murderProsecutors in Switzerland have charged a man with the February 2024 murder of his wife and former Miss Switzerland finalist Kristina Joksimovic, after uncovering evidence of a deliberate and brutal killing in Binningen.

Smelly Indians remark gets US techie the boot, sparks fresh anti-India trollingNik Pash, AI head at Cline, was fired after his racist comment on a hackathon photo sparked outrage on social media. But his sacking triggered a chain reaction of debates over what many called mob justice and overreaction to a 'harmless' comment.

Indian-origin woman, living in US for 32 years, detained at Green Card interviewBabblejit 'Bubbly' Kaur, 60, who has been living in the US since 1994, was detained on December 1 during a biometric scan for her pending Green Card application.

Desperate Delhi bans tandoors in its fight against pollutionWith AQI at hazardous levels and no solution in sight to fight pollution, the Delhi government has banned tandoors that use coal or firewood.

Will Skyroot develop a reusable rocket like Falcon-9? Founder answersThe idea of reusable rockets has transformed global spaceflight economics. SpaceX's success in routinely recovering and reflighting its boosters has reset expectations, lowering launch costs and increasing cadence.

Who is Meesho founder Vidit Aatrey, latest entrant to India's billionaire clubVidit Aatrey, the co-founder of Meesho Ltd, has entered the billionaire club as the company's shares climbed sharply to hit a fresh 52-week high in today's trade.

Are we asking the right questions? Design thinking says it's time to askDesign thinking is gaining a prominent place in institutions, public spaces and organisations. It is now influencing everyone, from individuals to large systems. This raises a key question: what is the right approach, and how can design thinking become part of daily life in a way that actually works? At its core, design thinking is a human-centred method that brings together people's needs, technological possibilities and the practical realities of business.

Messi event fiasco: Bengal Sports Minister quits, Mamata Banerjee to take chargeLionel Messi's Kolkata visit descended into chaos as angry fans ran riot at the iconic Salt Lake Stadium after failing to get even a glimpse of the Argentine football icon. The mess resulted in the resignation of West Bengal sports minister Aroop Biswas.

sports.headline: Paris St Germain ordered to pay Kylian Mbappe 60 million euros Paris St-Germain have been ordered by a French court to pay former striker Kylian Mbappe 60 million euros (£52.5 million) in unpaid salary and bonuses.

Jadeja 2.0? CSK buy uncapped Prashant Veer for record sum of Rs 14.2 crore IPL 2026 auction: Chennai Super Kings bought spin-bowling all-rounder Prashant Veer for Rs 14.20 crore, making him the joint-most expensive uncapped player in the history of the auction. They also spent Rs 14.2 crore for Rajasthan's Kartik Sharma.

New Dhoni in making? CSK make Kartik Sharma joint-most expensive uncapped player CSK have identified their long-term replacement for MS Dhoni as they made Kartik Sharma the joint-most expensive uncapped player in the history of the IPL auction.

Who is Auqib Nabi? J&K all-rounder bags Rs 8.40 crore IPL deal with DC IPL 2026 Auction: Delhi Capitals bought Jammu and Kashmir all-rounder Auqib Nabi Dar for Rs 8.40 crore at the IPL 2026 auction, which is being held in Abu Dhabi on Tuesday.

Tata honours India women's world cup-winning team with Sierra car Tata Motors honoured the Indian women's cricket team with Tata Sierra cars for their historic World Cup win. India registered their maiden World Cup triumph after beating South Africa by 52 runs in the final.

Delhi Capitals play it smart, buy David Miller and Ben Duckett at steal price Delhi Capitals made key bargain buys by signing David Miller and Ben Duckett in the IPL 2026 auction. Miller became the first player to be sold at the auction for Rs 2 crore.

Venkatesh Iyer takes 70 percent pay cut, sold to RCB for Rs 7 crore IPL 2026 mini auction: Venkatesh Iyer and David Miller endured significant pay cuts in the auction. Royal Challengers Bengaluru outbid Kolkata Knight Riders to buy Venkatesh for Rs 7 crore in Abu Dhabi on Tuesday.

IPL Auction 2026: Full list of sold, unsold, retained players of all 10 teams IPL 2026 Auction: Prashant Veer and Kartik Sharma stole the spotlight as the costliest Indian buys of the day, with CSK splurging Rs 14.2 crore on each. The duo also created history by becoming the joint-most-expensive uncapped players in IPL auction history. Meanwhile, Delhi Capitals made a notable move by signing Auqib Nabi Dar for Rs 8.4 crore. Here is the full list of sold, unsold and retained players of all 10 teams.

Cameron Green is IPL's most expensive overseas player Cameron Green's name lit up the IPL 2026 auction room and the bidding followed. Kolkata Knight Riders outlasted Chennai Super Kings to land the Australian all-rounder for a record Rs 25.20 crore.

Abhigyan Kundu scripts history in Youth ODIs with 209 vs Malaysia in U19 Asia Cup Abhigyan Kundu became only the second batter in Youth ODIs to score a double hundred when India and Malaysia locked horns in the U19 Asia Cup clash on Tuesday in Dubai.

Virat Kohli, wife Anushka visit Premanand Maharaj, video captures emotional moment Virat Kohli skipped the spotlight surrounding Lionel Messi's India tour. The former India captain instead visited Premanand Ji Maharaj in Vrindavan with wife Anushka Sharma for spiritual reflection.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi keeps growing in stature, with 25-ball fifty vs MalaysiaVaibhav Suryavanshi has been the driving force of India's U19 Asia Cup campaign, producing explosive knocks including a 25-ball fifty and a record-breaking 171 to underline his growing stature as a match-winner in youth cricket.

How Instagram cricketer Izaz Sawariya made his way into IPL 2026 auction listIzaz Sawariya, a 20-year-old Instagram creator from Bidar, has been listed in the IPL 2026 auction without any professional cricket experience. The talented wrist spinner has given trials for CSK and PBKS.

India vs South Africa, 4th T20I Predicted XI: Will Samson get a chance in Lucknow?IND vs SA, 4th T20I: Sanju Samson has an average of 72 and a strike-rate of 194.59 against South Africa, but the right-handed batter is yet to play a match in the ongoing series. Will he get a chance in Lucknow?

KKR can find their death overs answer in Matheesha Pathirana: Robin UthappaIPL 2026 auction: Robin Uthappa feels Matheesha Pathirana could be the answer to KKR's death-overs struggles. With the biggest purse at the IPL 2026 mini-auction, KKR are well placed to make a decisive move.

MS Dhoni-like star will be the costliest English buy at IPL auction: Monty PanesarFormer England spinner Monty Panesar has backed Jamie Smith to become the most expensive English player at the IPL 2026 auction. Smith is among 21 England players registered for the auction.

IPL 2026 auction: Five overseas stars who could fetch maiden dealsIPL 2026 auction: Several foreign players will be looking to bag their maiden deals when they go under the hammer in the auction to be held in Abu Dhabi on Tuesday.

Ashes: Pat Cummins returns as Australia make two changes for Adelaide TestAustralia captain Pat Cummins returns for the third Ashes Test in Adelaide after recovering from a bone stress injury. Apart from him, Nathan Lyon has also returned to the playing XI after being left out of the second Test in Brisbane.

CSK can benefit from Sarfaraz Khan deal in IPL 2026 mini-auction: RainaSuresh Raina believes Chennai Super Kings should target Sarfaraz Khan at the IPL 2026 mini-auction. The former CSK star feels Sarfaraz's domestic form makes him a smart, value-driven pick.

Live: KKR pay Rs 9.2 crore for Bangladesh's Mustafizur in accelerated roundIPL Auction 2026 live updates: The accelerated round is on. Kolkata Knight Riders have bought Bangladesh's Mustafizur Rahman for Rs 9.2 crore. Gujarat Titans buy Jason Holder for Rs 7 crore. Chennai Super Kings have gone away from their DNA, splurging big on uncapped players. They spent Rs 14.2 crore each on UP all-rounder Prashant Veer and Rajasthan wicketkeeper Kartik Sharma.

Ruben Amorim backs Manchester United defenders after 4-4 letdown vs BournemouthRuben Amorim defended Manchester United's backline after a chaotic 4-4 draw against Bournemouth. Despite conceding four goals, the United head coach insisted his defenders have quality and only need better collective defending.

IPL 2026 auction has a new rule and it's stirring a debateIPL Auction: The Indian Premier League mini-auction is set to take place in Abu Dhabi today. Ahead of the event, a major rule change has sparked widespread debate among fans, with many questioning whether the new regulation makes any sense at all.

Shubman Gill should play the Virat Kohli role in T20Is: Former wicketkeeperDeep Dasgupta has urged India's T20I vice-captain Shubman Gill to emulate Virat Kohli's anchoring role in the shortest format. Gill hasn't been in great form since his return to T20Is, having scored just 291 runs in 15 innings.

Why did Jasprit Bumrah leave IND vs SA series midway?Jasprit Bumrah left the India vs South Africa T20I series midway for personal reasons. The Indian pacer reportedly returned to Mumbai after a close family member was hospitalised, with his comeback depending on recovery.

IPL mini-auction complete guide: Where to watch, FAQs and top playersThe Indian Premier League auction is set to take place in Abu Dhabi on Tuesday, 15 December. In case you have missed the build-up, don't worry, we have you covered. Check out our article to know which team has the most purse, who will be the top picks, and where can you watch the event live.

Watch: Messi lands in Jamnagar to visit Anant Ambani's Vantara wildlife rescueLionel Messi extended his India visit with a planned trip to Jamnagar. The Argentine icon will visit Anant Ambani's Vantara wildlife rescue centre after concluding the G.O.A.T. India Tour 2025 in New Delhi.

Gap between SA and NZ series? Play Vijay Hazare, BCCI tells India starsThe BCCI has made it compulsory for all senior national players to participate in at least two Vijay Hazare Trophy matches. This move aims to ensure players do not treat domestic cricket as second-class tournaments.

IPL 2026 to begin on March 26, final scheduled for May 31: ReportThe 2026 edition of the Indian Premier League is likely to begin on March 26, with the final scheduled for May 31. Whether the opening match of the tournament will be played at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium is still under review.

4 cities, 1 GOAT: Lionel Messi's India tour that had it allLionel Messi's India tour moved through chaos and calm, heartbreak and joy. Across four cities, fans waited, erred, celebrated and found fleeting magic in the presence of football's greatest.

A hobbling body, heart left full: Sunil Chhetri reflects on his Messi moment at MumbaiSunil Chhetri opens up on meeting Lionel Messi during the Mumbai leg of the GOAT India Tour, revealing how the fan in him won amid injury struggles.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
